g.text: • Used for data storage and transfer
• Data enters serially at the input
• Each clock pulse shifts data one position right
• Data emerges serially after n clock pulses (n = register length)
• Used for data transmission and temporary storage
• Example: Input 1011 → Takes 4 clocks to appear at output
Clock 1: Input=1 → Q1=1, Q2=0, Q3=0, Q4=0
Clock 2: Input=0 → Q1=0, Q2=1, Q3=0, Q4=0
Clock 3: Input=1 → Q1=1, Q2=0, Q3=1, Q4=0
Clock 4: Input=1 → Q1=1, Q2=1, Q3=0, Q4=1
• All flip-flops load parallel data simultaneously
• Data shifts right on each clock pulse
• Serial output appears at rightmost FF
• Data loaded and read in parallel
